creator: udele.malabanan@na.whiteclarkegroup.com
text:
It would be nice to be able to have a confirmation message when exiting JMeter 
to ensure that the user actually wants to leave JMeter and not just minimize 
or resize the window.  This could also be configurable so that the user could 
disable this function if they feel that it is unnecessary.

Created attachment 20397
Proposed patch to src/core/org/apache/jmeter/gui/MainFrame.java

A simple dialog from the JOptionPane space to prompt for confirmation to close
the MainFrame. Perhaps the null reference to the method showConfirmDialog can
be replaced with the MainFrame instance if needed, but that might entail having
a reference to the MainFrame from within the WindowHappenings object.
creator: keerat@gmail.com

text:
If the test plan has not been saved since it was last changed, JMeter already 
prompts to save the plan.

Not sure it's worth having another dialogue - it's just going to annoy some 
people.
creator: sebb@apache.org
keerat@gmail.com
text: Fair point. With that in mind, this is clearly overkill.

Thanks anyway for the patch.

I'll close the bug; if enough people want it, it can be resurrected (but the 
new behaviour should definitely be optional).
